item.title: London riots: 'I don't want kids today to go down the same path'
item.description: Vernel Dolor was jailed for attacking police during the 2011 riots. How did he turn his life around?

item.title: Archbishop of York: English people feel left behind by metropolitan elites
item.description: Many English people are "patronised as backwardly xenophobic", the Archbishop of York says.

item.title: Wood Green stabbing: Man and police officers attacked in north London
item.description: The attack is not thought to be terrorism related and three people have been arrested, police said.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Daley wins bronze in men's 10m platform as Cao makes history
item.description: GB's Tom Daley wins bronze in men's 10m platform at Tokyo 2020 as China's Cao Yuan makes history.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: How many medals has your region won?
item.description: With day 14 of the competition over, the North West still leads the way when it comes to medals.

item.title: Adam Ellison: Reward upped to £24k to catch stab victim's killer
item.description: Trainee supermarket manager Adam Ellison was stabbed to death in Merseyside in 2017.

item.title: Prehistoric monument found on Biddenham housebuilding site
item.description: The 6,000-year-old monument is thought to have been used for ceremonies and rituals.

item.title: Verphy Kudi: Mum left girl to die to party for 6 days
item.description: Verphy Kudi's 20-month-old-daughter died from influenza and starvation after being left alone.

item.title: Duncan Browne: CCTV appeal to find witnesses in murder probe
item.description: Duncan Browne suffered a cardiac arrest after he was assaulted in Liverpool and died a day later.

item.title: Banksy-style pieces appear in Gorleston, Great Yarmouth and Lowestoft
item.description: An expert says he is "pretty sure" the works are by the artist "or they are very good fakes".

item.title: St Bees great-grandmother, 87, reunited with lost wedding ring
item.description: Ursula Rowlands was so thrilled when it was found in the soil, she put it straight on her finger.

item.title: Ed Sheeran named in Ipswich Town squad list and given number 17
item.description: The chart-topping artist lives in Suffolk and is a regular visitor to the club's ground.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing in Wales, Scotland, England and Northern Ireland
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: What are the social distancing rules across the UK?
item.description: Social distancing rules are changing across the UK.

item.title: ‘Covid passports’: How to get the NHS Covid Pass
item.description: People in England can use the pass for travel and to visit venues which ask for them.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid in Bradford: 'I just want to see mum and dad one last time'
item.description: Young people in Bradford share their intense experiences of the Covid pandemic in an inner city.

item.title: Covid-19: Man, 23, 'thought body could brush off virus'
item.description: Patients at the Royal Liverpool Hospital tell BBC North West Tonight about being ill with Covid-19.

item.title: London riots: 'My shop was burned down but we came back stronger'
item.description: Trevor Reeves and Bushra Ahmed both lost businesses during a night of violence in August 2011.

item.title: 'I proved them wrong'
item.description: John Noble's recovery from an accident which left him with severe injuries has been described as a "miracle".

item.title: Nottingham phone thieves distracted victims by dancing
item.description: Police say the men pretended to be drunk to distract their student victims.

item.title: Sam and Chris Gould: Twins' suicides lead to victim policing change
item.description: Sam and Chris Gould took their own lives after a sex abuse investigation was dropped.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Galal Yafai wins men's flyweight boxing gold with victory over Carlo Paalam
item.description: Britain's Galal Yafai wins Olympic gold in the men's 52kg flyweight boxing competition with a win over Carlo Paalam of the Philippines.

item.title: Robinson feared for England career following ban over tweets
item.description: Pace bowler Ollie Robinson says he feared he would never play for England again after the discovery of historical tweets that overshadowed his debut.

item.title: Parker's Bournemouth hold Ismael's West Brom in Championship opener
item.description: Scott Parker's Bournemouth draw the opening game of the Championship season against Valerien Ismael's West Bromwich Albion.

item.title: Harry Kane: Tottenham striker says he would never refuse to train and will return to club on Saturday
item.description: Tottenham striker Harry Kane says he has "never refused to train" and added he will return to the club on Saturday as planned
